meanings.definition: To look with eyes partly closed
meanings.sent1: She squintest at the bright light to protect her eyes.
meanings.sent2: I squintest when the sun is too bright.
meanings.sent3: The cat squintest at the tiny bug, trying to focus.
meanings.sent4: He squintest at the horizon, trying to make out the distant ship.
meanings.sent5: Squintest to see better in the sunlight.

meanings.sent1: The squintest person in the room had trouble seeing clearly.
meanings.sent2: She was teased for being the squintest in the class.
meanings.sent3: The squintest kid in school always made funny faces.
meanings.sent4: He was known as the squintest in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The squintest child had a unique perspective on the world.

meanings.definition: To look or peer with eyes partly closed, as in bright sunlight
meanings.sent1: They squintest as they walked into the blinding sunlight.
meanings.sent2: People often squintest when the sun is directly in their eyes.
meanings.sent3: The detective squintest at the clue, trying to decipher its meaning.
meanings.sent4: She squintest at the menu, struggling to read the small print.
meanings.sent5: Squintest to shield your eyes from the glaring light.
